verb.description: Cook (food, especially meat) by prolonged exposure to heat in an oven or over a fire.
examples: she was going to roast a leg of lamb for Sunday dinner
if you waste his time he'll roast you
a plate of cold roast beef

noun.description: A cut of meat that has been roasted or that is intended for roasting.
A banquet at which the guest of honor is subjected to good-natured ridicule.

origin: Middle English: from Old French rostir, of West Germanic origin.
